titles.title: United States Ambassador for ASEAN Act
United States Ambassador for ASEAN Affairs Act
United States Ambassador for ASEAN Affairs Act
A bill to establish the position of the United States Ambassador for ASEAN.
An act to establish the position of the United States Ambassador for ASEAN Affairs.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Foreign Relations.

calendar.text: Committee on Foreign Relations. Ordered to be reported with amendments favorably.

action.text: Committee on Foreign Relations. Reported by Senator Lugar with amendments and an amendment to the title. Without written report.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 457.

vote.text: Passed Senate with amendments and an amendment to the Title by Unanimous Consent.

reference.label: text of measure as reported in Senate

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Referred to the House Committee on International Relations.

term.name: Advice and consent of the Senate

bill.summary: 9/7/2006--Passed Senate amended. United States Ambassador for ASEAN Affairs Act - Establishes in the Department of State the position of U.S. Ambassador for ASEAN Affairs (Association of Southeast Asian Nations). Expresses the sense of Congress that a Deputy Assistant Secretary of State for East Asia and the Pacific should be designated as the Ambassador for ASEAN Affairs.
